Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Six manufacturers of Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM) computer chips agreed to pay $173 million to settle multistate litigation alleging they conspired in an illegal global scheme to fix prices. The breakdown by company was not initially announced but later was reported in the court document linked below.

NEC agreed to pay more than $3 million to the San Francisco Unified School District as part of a settlement of allegations of false claims, bribery and bid-rigging with other companies to win contracts to supply computer service and hardware to schools at inflated prices. The company pleaded guilty to two felony counts in the accompanying criminal case. This was part of a larger $20 million settlement with the U.S. Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-nec-business-network-solutions-inc
